title: Peter Mandelson’s arrest is ‘really damaging’ for Keir Starmer
description: Sky News contributor Sophie Elsworth claims Peter Mandelson’s arrest is “really damaging” to UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer.  “The public mood is not good here, the British public are very annoyed about this,” Ms Elsworth told Sky News host Peta Credlin.   “This is really damaging for Sir Keir Starmer because he is the one that appointed Peter Mandelson to this role.   “There are questions being asked on how did this happen? How did he get in this role in the first place, and there are documents due to be released that looks at how the appointment happened.”

title: Anthony Albanese evacuated from The Lodge after security concern
description: Sky News host Paul Murray says Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has been evacuated from The Lodge after a secruity concern.

title: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese evacuated from The Lodge
description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has been evacuated from The Lodge in Canberra on Tuesday evening.   Australian Federal Police were sent to Mr Albanese's house and he has been moved to another location.  It is understood that the police were responding to reports of a threat.   The security incident unfolded about 6pm on Tuesday, federal police said.   "A thorough search of a protection establishment has commenced and is still ongoing," the Australian Federal Police said.  "There is no current threat to the community or public safety."

title: Bondi Beach massacre responders and eyewitnesses detail overwhelming experiences
description: Community Health Service’s Darren Chait recounts his experiences during the Bondi Beach massacre.  The full documentary, Bondi: A Timeline of Terror is available to stream at Skynews.com.au

title: ‘Grab some bandages and plug the holes’: Kellie Sloane reflects on Bondi Beach massacre
description: NSW Opposition Leader Kellie Sloane reminisces on the Bondi Beach massacre and the traumatic scenes that prompted her to assist in helping victims of the attack.  The full documentary, Bondi: A Timeline of Terror is available to stream at Skynews.com.au

title: Two-party system in Australian politics ‘under enormous stress’
description: Redbridge Group Director Kos Samaras says the two-party system in Australian politics is “under enormous stress”.  “I think they can change leaders all they want, the fundamental problem is that … the two-party system in our country is under enormous stress,” Mr Samaras told Sky News host Paul Murray.  “No amount of a spin, no amount of anything in that space is going to change people’s minds.”

title: Albanese evacuated from The Lodge, AFP claims no threat to public safety
description: Sky News Political Reporter Cameron Reddin says Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has been evacuated from The Lodge, with the Australian Federal Police stating there is no threat to public safety.

title: NHS informs staff to choose pronouns and ‘make them plain’ to colleagues and patients
description: Sky News host James Macpherson says the NHS is telling its staff to choose their pronouns and make them apparent to both colleagues and patients.   “Let me talk about the NHS in the UK because they are telling hospital staff that they need to choose their own pronouns and make them plain both to colleagues and to patients,” Mr Macpherson said.  “You can call yourself I/Me, They/Them, Ze/Zir. … Xey/Xem.”

title: Reports Sarah Ferguson checked into Swiss mental health clinic
description: Sky News contributor Sophie Elsworth weighs in on reports Sarah Ferguson checked into a Swiss mental health clinic amid controversy over her links to Jeffrey Epstein.  “She looks terrible out of all of this as well, but she seems to have gone into hiding; she hasn’t been seen out in public since December,” Ms Elsworth told Sky News host Peta Credlin.  “There were reports she was at a Swiss mental health clinic, which was some absorbent amount, I think it was about $20,000 a night.   “She’s nowhere to be seen, and we know they’ve been joined at the hip for decades, even though they are divorced.  “More will certainly come out about her, I suspect.”

title: ‘Foolish’ Zohran Mamdani condemned for ‘half-hearted’ approach to election law
description: Cygnal Principal and Pollster Alex Tarascio condemns New York City Mayor Zohran Mamdani for his “foolish” stance on voter ID.   “I don’t know why there is this ideological crusade to get us to know who is voting in the federal election,” Mr Tarascio told Sky News Digital Presenter Gabriella Power.  “If he was really a committed leftist, Mamdani would have had a separate bus just for illegal aliens to be allowed to volunteer and not get paid.  “It probably would have gotten more goodwill than what he did, which was just foolish.  “I don’t understand what he is trying to achieve by this half-hearted following of the law in one place, but not another.”

title: Abigail Spanberger dubbed a ‘far-left’ radical ahead of State of the Union response
description: Newsweek Senior Editor-at-Large Josh Hammer claims “far-left” Virginia Governor Abigail Spanberger’s response to US President Donald Trump’s State of the Union address will preview how Democrats plan to campaign in the midterms.  “She is someone who the media frequently touts as a moderate … and she’s governed frankly as a far-left California-style Gavin Newsom radical since coming into office there,” Mr Hammer told Sky News Digital Presenter Gabriella Power.  “The big question is what tone is she going to strike? What exactly is she going to say there?  “The way that Spanberger goes in her response, I think, is going to be quite telling as to how the Democrats intend to campaign on the campaign trail.”

title: AOC mocked for ‘crashing out’ amid fallout from ‘shocking’ Munich appearance
description: Sky News Digital Presenter Gabriella Power mocks Democrat Congresswoman Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez after she “crashed out” following backlash to her awkward performance at the Munich Security Conference.  “Let’s start with AOC, Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, she’s responded to the criticism of her shocking performance in Munich,” Ms Power said.   “She’s been crashing out as she records herself on camera.  “Does this clear everything up? Does this restore confidence that she has any clue about what on Earth is going on when it comes to foreign policy?”

title: Trump predicted to ‘use force’ over escalating Mexico cartel violence
description: Cygnal Principal and Pollster Alex Tarascio says the level of cartel violence in Mexico is “impossible to ignore” by the Trump administration, predicting it will prompt intervention and the use of force.  “They are exporting violence in a way that I think the Trump administration may find impossible to ignore,” Mr Tarascio told Sky News Digital Presenter Gabriella Power.  “The strangest thing about this is that normally, it doesn’t break through that there are fires in a vacation destination where lots of Westerners go.   “When that does start to happen, that makes it easier for a US administration who has clearly shown it’s willing to use force, to perhaps use more force.   “I would expect that is at least on Donald Trump’s mind, if not actively being planned right now.”

title: Donald Trump not interested in lasting ‘military quagmire’ in Iran amid escalating tensions
description: Former White House Press secretary Sean Spicer says US President Donald Trump is “loath” to get involved in a military quagmire that could last for years, as tensions between the US and Iran over the Iranian nuclear program escalate.   “I think that the Iranians caught a break with our State of the Union occurring. The President obviously wants to focus tremendously on domestic politics, talking about affordability, the border issues that he campaigned on,” Mr Spicer told Sky News host Andrew Bolt.  “Explaining to people why it’s in our national interest is a little bit more complicated than, say, Venezuela … with Iran, it does pose a threat and instability in the region … going in there and having stability after a potential regime change is not something that’s in the cards right now.  “President Trump is loath to get involved in a sort of military quagmire that could last for years.”

title: ‘Make it make sense’: Zohran Mamdani blasted over voter ID double standard
description: Newsweek Senior Editor-at-Large Josh Hammer blasts New York City Mayor Zohran Mamdani, accusing him of a double standard for requiring ID to shovel snow during the city’s blizzard while opposing voter ID.  “I cannot make it make sense … this blizzard is actually really bad,” Mr Hammer told Sky News Digital Presenter Gabriella Power.  “They should have seen this coming. New York City basically shut down for essentially 24 hours; there were no taxis, no cars on the road, it’s a veritable mess there.   “If you’re going to have the chutzpah to offer a $30 minimum wage with all the economic repercussions that has … shouldn’t you offer that same wage to people to shovel snow in the worst blizzard?   “It makes no sense … the guy just has no idea what he’s doing.”
